label: thm-total-expected-cloning-action-continuity
conclusion: Total expected cloning action is continuous function of swarm state
proof_technique: Decomposition via intermediate term and triangle inequality
context: Section 16: The Cloning Transition Measure, subsection 15.2.4
relations_established: Total expected cloning action is continuous
label_text: Continuity of the Total Expected Cloning Action
full_statement_text:
Let $\mathcal{S}_1$ and $\mathcal{S}_2$ be two swarm states, with $k_1 = |\mathcal{A}(\mathcal{S}_1)| > 0$. The **Total Expected Cloning Action** is continuous with respect to the N-Particle Displacement Metric. For any walker $i$, the change in its total cloning probability is bounded:
$$

|\overline{P}_{\text{clone}}(\mathcal{S}_1)_i - \overline{P}_{\text{clone}}(\mathcal{S}_2)_i| \le E_{\text{struct}}^{(\overline{P})}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2) + E_{\text{val}}^{(\overline{P})}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2)

$$
where the two error components are bounded in the subsequent lemmas.
